tweets.html:
C'mon, let's overlook the Constitution just this once to try Reese Witherspoon as an enemy combatant.

— Damien Fahey (@DamienFahey) April 22, 2013

I want to see Matt Lauer and Brian Stelter jello wrestle each other

— Megan Johnson (@megansarahj) April 23, 2013

Someday maybe I'll be able to watch "Bates Motel" w/out thinking, "What the BLEEP does this have to do w/'Psycho'?!?"

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) April 23, 2013

BREAKING: @ap Twitter feed hacked by @cnn.

— Crutnacker (@Crutnacker) April 23, 2013

RT @AP: Glee is a good show

— rob delaney (@robdelaney) April 23, 2013

New York Post reporting 12 Barack Obamas killed

— slackbot (@pareene) April 23, 2013

REUTERS REPORTER 1: "Did you hear the AP fell victim to a hack?" REUTERS REPORTER 2: "You mean more than usual?" (They high-five.)

— Mike Drucker (@MikeDrucker) April 23, 2013

In honor of Earth Day, simply recycle last week's CNN jokes and replace CNN with AP. Repeat until next crisis.

— Crutnacker (@Crutnacker) April 23, 2013

RT @AP AMC renews Rubicon for a surprise second season

— David Sims (@davidlsims) April 23, 2013

There is a third season of Melissa & Joey coming 5/29, in case you were worried about Melissa Hart and/or Joey Lawrence.

— Robert Lloyd (@LATimesTVLloyd) April 23, 2013

Just stood next to Chris Noth at an intersection. I'm living out my mom's bucket list.

— Chase Mitchell (@ChaseMit) April 23, 2013

What's neat about Diana Rigg on GoT is that in a non-travesty update of The Avengers Natalie Dormer would make a great Emma Peel.

— Jessica Ritchey (@Ruby_Stevens) April 23, 2013

America is truly out of fresh ideas if 2016 ends up being Newt Gingrich on CNN talking about a Clinton v. Bush presidential race.

— pourmecoffee (@pourmecoffee) April 23, 2013

Once he realizes how bad things are, Newt Gingrich will just leave an ailing CNN for a healthier network in the long run.

— itsonlyzach (@itsonlyzach) April 24, 2013

I think Tuesday is being such an asshole because it misses #Justified as much as I do.

— BurnThemAll (@aboleyn) April 23, 2013

Why would Reese Witherspoon cancel a talk show appearance NOW? It's literally the only time I'd tune if for a Reese Witherspoon interview.

— Morgan Murphy (@morgan_murphy) April 23, 2013

I don't think my therapist likes it when I call him at night just to quote lines from shows that may not survive May Sweeps.

— Richie (@RichieOnTV) April 23, 2013

If your show isn't as good as The Wire, The Shield, or Top of the Lake, you may not make a show about cops. It will suck.

— Muffin MacGuffinüïØ (@MuffMacGuff) April 23, 2013

tweets.author_name: Amy celebrates Wrinkle in Time instead of XMas
tweets.html:
Guys, I don't WANT to be excited about the stupid fucking Guardians of the Galaxy movie. GOD DAMMIT LEE PACE.

— Amy celebrates Wrinkle in Time instead of XMas (@spooloflies) April 23, 2013

Matt Saracen is just the best. All the tiny hearts drawn around his name. #FNLRewatch

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) April 23, 2013

The third judge on Dancing With the Stars is a Dudley Moore character, right?

— Crutnacker (@Crutnacker) April 24, 2013

Still waiting for the Storage Wars people to find my locker full of dildos and scorpions.

— helv (@highwaytohelv) April 24, 2013

TV broadcasters in 1990s: "You must carry our shows, cable industry!"
TV broadcasters in 2010s: "You must not carry our shows, Aereo!"

— Scott Woolley (@scottwoolley) April 24, 2013

301 views on YouTube is the new 4.1 rating in the demo. #HoldUpBro

— Max Dawson (@fymaxwell) April 24, 2013

I'm having a FlashForward to Revolution being cancelled. RT @TheCancelBear: REVOLUTION ratings adjusted down to a new series low...

— Jeff Greenstein (@blue439) April 24, 2013

Fox News is the loud drunk at the end of the bar. MSNBC is the guy asking if the beer was humanely brewed. CNN is 99% sure it's not a bar.

— Mark Harris (@MarkHarrisNYC) April 24, 2013

God, it would be so great if "Game of Thrones" revealed a new city in Westeros, and it just turned out to be present-day Minneapolis.

— Tim Carvell (@timcarvell) April 24, 2013

Zooey Deschanel always looks like she's been shown a card trick

— Brian Gaar (@briangaar) April 24, 2013

"Boo Radley" is not only the name of a character from To Kill A Mockingbird, but also something a ghost from the 80s does.

— demi adejuyigbe (@electrolemon) April 24, 2013

There's a version of #Suburgatory that's one of the best comedies on TV. Sadly, what we have doesn't seem interested in being that show.

— Grace (@GemOfAmara) April 24, 2013

It's kind of amazing that Erin is such a great character on The Office when every storyline about her personal life sucks.

— Muffin MacGuffinüïØ (@MuffMacGuff) April 24, 2013

[insert tweet related to an advanced screener for an upcoming season finale here]

— Noel Kirkpatrick (@noelrk) April 24, 2013

RT @noelrk: [Man, who knew the season finale of New Girl had so many zombies with hepatitis in it? Seriously guys, I have a screener.]

— meaning machine (@EricThurm) April 24, 2013

I don't care if the Ricin guy was setup, all Elvis impersonators should be considered enemy combatants.

— pourmecoffee (@pourmecoffee) April 24, 2013

‚Äú@piersmorgan: That interview with the freed ricin suspect Kevin Curtis may just be the weirdest of my life.‚Äù <- and that's saying something

— üéÑmanda BüéÅwer (@heyprofbow) April 24, 2013

"I predict a lot of TV shows will have swingers episodes. Let's make a song to license for the establishing party scene." - Daft Punk

— Bryan Murphy (@Bryan_Murphy) April 24, 2013

You know who would have reported everything he saw on Twitter at face value? Ted Baxter.

— Ben Greenman (@bengreenman) April 24, 2013

Catching up with Hannibal. Reserving judgment re quality, but TV-14 is absurd. What is NBC saving TV-MA for, an actual snuff film?

— Mark Harris (@MarkHarrisNYC) April 24, 2013

I'm making @moryan read the sorority letter on tomorrow night's podcast. But as Laura Roslin from #BSG.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) April 24, 2013

OK, Im rewriting sorority girl letter in the voice of BSGs Laura Roslin. Damn you @TVMcGee & yr fiendishly awesome ideas. Podcast extra Weds

— Mo Ryan (@moryan) April 24, 2013

@moryan I do not give a flying frak, and Sigma Nu does not give a flying frak!

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) April 24, 2013

The second season of Joey averaged a 2.8 18-49 rating, then considered terrible for NBC.

— Grace (@GemOfAmara) April 24, 2013

If #TheAmericans existed solely to show KeriRussell giving an ass-kicking performance or just for Margo-Keri scenes,it'd be reason enough

— Mo Ryan (@moryan) April 24, 2013

Thinking the Next on Mad Men bits make more sense if you think of them less as a promo & more as a Vine.

— üéÑmanda BüéÅwer (@heyprofbow) April 24, 2013

How is anybody complaining about Mad Men when it's given us Stan Rizzo rocking leather fringe and the world's most luxurious beard?

— Michael O'Connell (@mikeylikestv) April 24, 2013

"I like this part of The Vanilla Ice Project where Vanilla Ice smells one of his worker's farts." - something I'm sure someone just said

— kevinbiegel (@kbiegel) April 24, 2013

Somebody's job is to stand behind SportsCenter anchors and force them to reference no fewer than two tweets per segment.

— Michael O'Connell (@mikeylikestv) April 24, 2013

After VERONICA MARS, Kickstarter's now the 'cold dose of reality' venue for celebs.

— Stephen Gallagher (@brooligan) April 24, 2013

Oh fun. Even with fewer contestants, we still don't see all the Battle Rounds. That's fab. #TheVoice

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) April 24, 2013

"I don't know this song that you wrote" is not the best technique for winning a Battle Round. #TheVoice

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) April 24, 2013

Carson Daly, please stop sounding so excited when you scream "We've got a steal!!" We don't care. You don't care. Take it down.

— Mark Harris (@MarkHarrisNYC) April 24, 2013

I may have been watching Splash on ABC for the last hour.

— FLAMES ON (@thesideofmyface) April 24, 2013

Joey Lawrence's hair looks like the haunch of a chestnut mare. #splash

— Tara Ariano (@TaraAriano) April 24, 2013

What kind of lazy country is this where we cant figure out how to combine Smash and Splash into one show?

— Richard Rushfield (@richardrushfield) April 24, 2013

Some nights, happiness is realizing the reruns are new to me, at least. #NewGirl #TheMindyProject

— Ellen Gray (@elgray) April 24, 2013

It appears that someone will have to let me know when #HartOfDixie exits this creative tailspin, because I've grown intolerant to it.

— Myles McNutt (@Memles) April 24, 2013

Okay, Wade in those silly goggles might have made up for a lot of things in this episode. #adorable #HartofDixie

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) April 24, 2013

Jake, why is your hair...the way it is? #Awkward

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) April 24, 2013

Suddenly Sadie & Matty's friendship is infinitely more interesting than his relash with Jenna #Awkward

— Jarett Wieselman (@JarettSays) April 24, 2013

Neat #Awkward trick: Keeping the deepest feelings of its narrator hidden and then using that as a bit of a gut-punch story device. Crafty.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) April 24, 2013

The Carrie Diaries, Awkward, ... I need one more show to officially establish the "Asian high school female sidekick" trend!

— Mike Stein (@MikeSteinOnline) April 24, 2013
